intro: Microcharis praetermissa, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, with a distinct aromatic scent. The fruit is a small, green berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds.
